alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 5:42PM EST until January 03 at 5:58AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. Red River at Clay City affecting Powell and Estill Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville affecting Owsley County. Kentucky River near Ravenna affecting Estill County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. The bridge at Upper Wolf Creek Road, Shephards Lane, and the east end of Applegate Road at Buck Creek are impassable. At 35.0 feet, Water enters the basement of a home off of Highway 30 on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 31.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 PM EST Saturday was 31.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 5 AM.
